SENT.plain: In vivo experiments in dogs demonstrated angiographically that the subarachnoid injection of blood produced cerebral arterial apasm both immediately after the injection of blood and 2 days later
The sublingual adminstration of nifedipine reversed both the acute and the delayed cerebral arterial spasm
In addition, sublingual administration of nifedipine 20 minutes before the subarachnoid injection of blood prevented the acute spasm
